ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The Caribbean field trip was probably my favorite week at FES, from both a learning and a pleasure standpoint. Highly recommended! It's a fantastic experience.
On the field trip, I found it particularly useful to talk to Jonathan Little of CZM, Anne Marie of TNC, and meeting the UVI professors/students.
The field component of this class was very insightful. The material covered in the course was helpful in developing an better understanding of the coastal management issues of the Virgin Islands.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: See above â fieldtrip was fantastic. Benoit is very well connected in the region, and he introduces us to some amazing people.

The field trip was amazing. I think it could have been more academically rigorous, it felt like experiential learning versus us having to produce something. The people we met and talked to were all very interesting and generous with their time, and a big highlight of the trip.
The incredibly well organized and well thought out field component in the Virgin Islands
The field trip portion of this course was the best aspect in terms of learning opportunities, access to experienced individuals, and content.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: After field trip, class just kind of peters out. I wish that we processed the field trip in a more meaningful way than our individual projects. Don't get me wrong, it was great to have some time to chill out... but yeah, the class just sort of ends abruptly.

Some of the readings could use updating. I also think this would be a great opportunity to talk about environment-development conflicts and the tourism influence in the island. We didn't really touch on tourism, however,
Would like to have met after spring break as well
More direction is needed in terms of guiding and connecting our final assignment and research with the subject matter and purpose of the course.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Little discussion â class is mostly lecture-based, aside from the field trip.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: As one of the few marine/coastal aficionados at FES, this class is one of the few course offerings that pertains directly to my interests.
This is the only Caribbean-related course at Yale F&ES, and as this is the area I am focusing on, it was perfect for my program. It was great to have this perspective on the Caribbean.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more about how terrestrial impacts affect coastal ecosystems (and because so few other classes here actually address that question), and for the field trip.
Geographic location of the course -the Caribbean is my area of interest, in addition to the coastal/marine component of the course.
To gain a broader policy and scientific understanding of coastal ecosystems in island communities.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: For the most part.

I ended up working in a different direction than initially planned, and I ended up learning a lot about the radionuclide analysis technique, so the skills that I gained were valuable but not what I initially expected.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Shared the burden of work, enjoyed each other's company.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Absolutely take it! Make sure your spring break is reserved.

Pick a project topic early, and a topic that is manageable. You tend to want to think big initially, but selecting a specific project that is particularly relevant to St. Thomas would be the most valuable area.
Have a very clear and concrete idea of why you want to take the course and the research you want to do. The more specific you can be, especially in terms of geographical area, the better.
